Comment: Slightly unusual, Nc3 is more common
I prevent e4. I call this the semi-grunfeld, but I see the opening database calls it the King's Indian (E60), 3.g3, counterthrust variation.
So now I had to start thinking for myself. This move seemed reasonable, to blunt his Bg2. Afterwards I saw that Nb6 and Nc6 are more commonly played.
I thought that this was most consistent, but I found out later Nb6 is more usual
I put pressure on the centre. I am threatening to take on f3 then d4
